snippet: Mr. Hirabayashi, along with Fred Korematsu and Minoru Yasui, symbolized protest against unchecked governmental powers in a time of war.
abstract: Gordon Hirabayashi, challenger of the government's internment of Japanese-Americans during World War II, dies at age 93.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Hirabayashi, along with Fred Korematsu and Minoru Yasui, symbolized protest against unchecked governmental powers in a time of war.

headline.seo: Gordon Hirabayashi, WWII Internment Opponent, Was 93
headline.main: Gordon Hirabayashi, World War II Internment Opponent, Dies at 93
